thread.title: Three students die after falling off suburban train in Chennai
thread.title_full: Three students die after falling off suburban train in Chennai

title: Three students die after falling off suburban train in Chennai
text: Three students die after falling off suburban train in Chennai Three students die after falling off suburban train in Chennai Siddharth Prabhakar Two students died and five others suffered serious injuries when they fell off a suburban train in Chennai on Thursday morning. |   11.01 AM IST The accident happened between Palavanthangal and St Thomas Mount railway stations. (TOI photo by R Ramesh Shankar) CHENNAI: Three students died and four others suffered serious injuries after falling off a suburban train in Chennai on Thursday morning. The students were standing on the footboard of a Tirumalpur -Chennai Beach suburban train when the bag of one of the victims was caught in a signal post between Palavanthangal and St Thomas Mount railway stations, dragging him down, according to a Railway Protection Force officer. Six others who stood near him lost balance and fell down. Two of them died on the spot, and another died while being taken to Government Hospital at Chromepet. The accident happened around 9.15am. The deceased and the injured were students. They were yet to be identified. It was not known where they were studying.
